_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Colonial Terminals, Inc. owns and operates a bulk storage and warehousing facility in Savannah, Georgia. Colonial Terminals, Inc. is dedicated to providing a safe and healthy work environment for all its employees. The plant injects butane into gasoline to alter the octane rating. The butane is unloaded from 180,000 lb. railcars and blended into the atmospheric gasoline storage tanks. The butane unloading process is subject to EPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP) regulations as well as

OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) regulatory requirements.



Colonial Terminals, Inc recently installed additional butane unloading.  As per the RMP requirements, the facility is required to update its RMP Plan according to 40 CFR 68.190.  This submittal includes the updated inventory of butane located at the facility (the maximum inventory is based on storage of 4 railcars) and updated Program Level 3 Prevention Program data.  Below are brief descriptions of other required executive summary elements as specified in 40 CFR 68.155.



The site's accidental release prevention program was developed in accordance with the RMP and PSM regulatory requirements and includes all of the required elements. Chemical-specific prevention steps for butane include:

-    Upgraded process equipment

-    Increased the number of LEL detection sensors from 4 to 7

-    Improved technology of LEL sensors (IR vs. catalytic bead)

-    Interlock of Emergency Shut down with response of LEL sensors

-    Added remote visibility of LEL conditions and alarms

 

Emergency Response to any potential incident at the plant is accomplished in accordance with the site's Integrated Contingency Plan. The Integrated Contingency Plan identifies response capabilities and complies with requirements of OSHA, EPA, USCG, and Georgia EPD. The plan is reviewed annually. There have been no RMP reportable accidental releases from the facility in the past five (5) years. The most recent PHA included several recommendations that have resulted

in equipment and procedure improvements to mitigate identified risks. Safety improvements planned for the future include Integration of high LEL condition with plant-wide evacuation notification system.
